thread.title: Chi Onwurah on conference week - 'The Tories have no vision and no plan'

author: Mike Fuller
title: Chi Onwurah on conference week - 'The Tories have no vision and no plan'
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Newcastle Central MP Chi Onwurah praised the “vibrancy” of the Labour Party conference. 
The Labour MP has been speaking with the Conservative conference still to come. See what she had to say above. 
In his leader’s speech Jeremy Corbyn claimed Labour had taken over the political mainstream. 
Ms Onwurah said: “The conference was the most inspired, vibrant and dynamic I’ve been at for many a year. Read More MP tries to navigate Newcastle's Central Station wearing blind goggles and this is what happened 
“What we’re saying about bringing back utilities into public control, an end to austerity and investment does reflect what people want. 
“Austerity has gone on for far too long, people are poorer now than they were 10 years ago so yes changing that is absolutely the mainstream of where people are today.” Newcastle Central MP, Chi Onwurah (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) 
The Tory Party conference is being held in Manchester next week. They aim to appeal to more younger voters. 
Prime Minister Theresa May has said: “I think there is a generation out there who feel that they’re going to be worse off than their parents. 
“What we want as Conservatives is that people should be able to see a brighter future for their children.” 
Ms Onwurah admitted she will be watching to see what happens. Read More Liberal Democrat leader Vince Cable reveals plan to stop Brexit and keep us in the EU 
She said: “What the Tory Party do and say not only affects us know but in the future. 
“So of course it’s essential to pay attention to what they are doing, but it’s a combination between a farce and a tragedy you don’t know what will happen next. 
“They’ve got no vision and no plans. The sooner they make way for a Labour Government the better.” Like us on Facebook
